intro: Alsinanthus verticillatus, commonly known as the clustered alsike, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces trifoliate leaves and has pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Alsinanthus verticillatus is also valued for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility.
